title: Trying to figure out why I have low FPS
body:
I"m currently experiencing FPS between 15-30 and am trying to figure out why it is so low even with all the graphics set to "Very Low" (and shadows turned off). I suspect it is either due to the Mac client or possibly my graphics card? My system:

* Mac Client
* OS X 10.10.1
* 2.8 GHz Intel Core 2 Duo
* 8 GB RAM
* NVIDIA GeForce 9400M 256 MB

Any ideas?

replies.body:
>The Nvidia GeForce 9400M G is an integrated (onboard) graphics card for laptops without dedicated graphics memory.

Source: http://www.notebookcheck.net/NVIDIA-GeForce-9400M-G.11949.0.html

Integrated graphics are never good to run video-games with, especially one that's seven years old. League was made well after that, and honestly was never designed to run on such low resources. I'm surprised that it's playable at all.

Yeah figured that was probably it. Mostly runs fine at 30 fps but will drop to 15 fps if the computer gets hot which is a bit unplayable. Guess I'll have to buy a decent gaming pc when I get the money.

Was gonna mention about how heat really affects integrated chips more than others, mostly due to the fact that an integrated chip cannot have its own fans to cool it. Have you considered getting a cooling fan? Last I checked they were around $20.
